questions.question_text: When configuring the Onboarding Lifecycle Event, the HR Admin did not select an Audience for the 'Select a Desk' task. If a remote employee is being onboarded. how does the system handle this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct: D. 
The activity set will trigger.

Selected Answer: D
If no audience record is selected, then the activity for the activity to trigger in the case.
The audience criteria for an activity set applies first. When the audience criteria is met, the activity set executes. The audience at the activity level is then checked and executed.

You cannot set an audience for activity sets that have a trigger type of Rescind.

Selected Answer: D
if there isn't an audience record, the activity is triggered

choices.D: The activity will be triggered and must be manually closed
choices.C: The Lifecycle Event will be canceled
choices.A: The Lifecycle Event rescind process will be triggered

questions.question_text: When configuring a record on the COE ACL Configuration module how can you apply the conditions to all HR services for the COE?

choices.D: Select each HR service using the Services list
choices.A: Add a filter condition for each HR service
choices.B: Select the Applies to all services box
choices.C: Write a new ACL record for each HR service

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer - p. 151 from HR Implementation - Tokyo eBook

Selected Answer: B
HR Implementation ebook page 151
B - see page 151 of Implementation guide (Tokyo) - 2nd Note

choices.D: From the User dropdown in the banner, elevate your role to security_admin
choices.B: Manually add the security_admin role to your User record
choices.A: Manually add the Delegated Developer role to your User record
choices.C: From the User dropdown in the banner, elevate your role to delegated_developer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Itâ€™s rather D, because if you do not have security_admin you cannot just add it. You would need to elevate to security_admin first.

Selected Answer: B
It depends.. 
The security_admin role is not automatically granted to Admins.. 
So if the ACL needs to be created and this Admin does not have the role, the first thing that needs to be done is B.
Else, if he already has the role, Elevating to Security Admin role is the correct answer (D)

questions.question_text: If you have both Admin [admin] and HR Admin [sn_hr_core.admin] roles and want to configure an Access Control Rule for the HR Payroll table, which of the following must first be done?

choices.A: Grant them delegated developer role to the global application scope
choices.C: Grant them delegated developer role only to the HR Integrations application scope
choices.B: Advise the customer this work must be completed in Production
choices.D: Submit an exception request to allow them to have the Admin role

questions.question_text: The customer has a group of developers who will be tasked with making subprod updates to the HR Integrations application. Customer policy states these developers cannot be granted the System Administrator [admin] role. Which of these is the best solution for granting the appropriate access needed to complete development work m the HR application?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Answer is B: Parental Leave = lifecycle event

questions.question_text: When an employee contacts HR, they speak in terms of lifecycle events. From an HR perspective, that event gets translated into several HR services that need to be performed. Of the following items, which would be considered a lifecycle event?
